title: Random Question
content: Is it true that students are divided after each semester based on score and are allotted sections respectively. Do they shuffle students after each year/semester?

comments.body: In the first year, it is completely random. Students from all branches are put together in each section. However, things change from the second year. I don't know about the pre-COVID era, but for my batch, we were divided into sections in the alphabetical order of our names.
The method isn't very transparent pre-COVID, but it was based on GPA. But it wasn't "highest GPA in a class", kids in a class have varying GPAs.

First year was random I believe with a mix across branches.

I believe the next year onwards it went in SRN order. So the first enrolled student was in A, second in B and so on. Your class stays the same across 2nd, 3rd and 4th year though

\> From second year on-wards, the section remains the same until you graduate

\> The students are divided based on SRN and GPA; they ensure that every section is equally competitive

\> You didn't ask but no, you cannot change your sections once allotted

It's the same for the first 2 sems. Then depending on your section composition (if everyone's from the same branch or not) you may have some changes here and there

You didn't get your srns yet? It's mostly alphabetical and dependent on when you join if I'm right. One big drawback is that you'll have 5-6 classmates with the same name lol
No we didnt get srn yet. So will the sections be shuffled even if all the students are from same branch?

I'm not sure on how they do it without srns. For us it was same branch and srn wise which is mostly alphabetical. Unless you join through the later stages of cet and you'll not be in alphabetical order as these are in the last few sections (seriously 12 sections is a lot). Otherwise if your class is a mix of students from different branches, the ones belonging to the same branch will remain to do so and the gaps will be filled by shifting from previous/next sections in alphabetical order (approximately 60-65 in one section)

It will be shuffled. There is no guarantee your CSE friends in your current section will also be there with you for the next 3 years.
